Text: I see...
What do you think?

I think the proposal document is very well put
together.

You've meticulously laid out all the steps and
necessary components to complete this project.
Then—

But there are too many uncertain elements in your
submitted business plan.
What do you mean by uncertain elements?!

Let's start with the basic premise of your plan: your
debut as a pianist in the Oriana Kingdom.
There's nothing uncertain about that!

Many nobles in Oriana wish to serve as patrons for
talented artists, even if they are still unknowns!

I understand the artistic climate, but are you
certain your talent will be in demand?

There are no certainties when it comes to the
artistic!

That's a problem. On the one hand, we have the
Garden's money and time to consider, but more
importantly, it'll require the full-time investment
of the invaluable human resource that is you.

Your plan also touches on the synergy between
"publicity for the fashion and tea divisions."
However...

We currently have no plans to expand our fashion
business in the Oriana Kingdom.

The reason for this is that the fashion tastes in
Oriana are more sophisticated than in other
countries.

There isn't much demand for the clothing we are
currently attempting to develop at Luna, Ltd.—
inexpensive, durable, and designed to have broad
appeal.

More than anything, Luna, Ltd. can't afford to spend
time and resources on developing formalwear for women
at present, even if you were to wear and promote it.

I get that! But I guarantee it will be in demand in
the future!

We could expand our fashion division to include more
design-oriented outfits! That way, we can be certain
to have a head start in Oriana once it catches on!

"We can be certain"? You just said there were no
certainties.
Urk...

Let's bring in someone well-versed in the Oriana
Kingdom. Lambda!
Yes, I'm here!

Lambda, you were a soldier of the Velgalta Empire,
gathering intel on the Oriana Kingdom for a time.

From your experience, what do you think of Epsilon's
plan?
Right, I'll take a look at the document!
Lambda...?
...Allow me to state my humble opinion!

From what I can see, this project is likely to
succeed!

Hold on, Lambda! Are you just siding with Epsilon to
pay back the debt you owe her?

As you say, Lady Gamma, I owe a debt to Lady Epsilon
for curing me...but that has nothing to do with this!

Firstly, as far as linking it to our fashion venture,
I believe this is currently unnecessary! And as for
synergy with the other ventures, the Alexandria-made
tea alone should be sufficient!
Oh? Why's that?

In the Oriana Kingdom, it is not only artistic talent
that's important, but the narrative surrounding the
artist as well.

A diamond in the rough is far better received by
would-be patrons of the aristocracy than one that is
overly polished!

I see. I guess that's what they call psychology-based
logic. Well, Gamma, do you have any objections to
promoting our tea?

Well...tea is associated with the salons of the
aristocrats who surround the artists.

But what guarantee is there that Epsilon can acquire
patrons of the aristocracy?

With all due respect, Lady Gamma, success depends on
the luck of the draw. In high-stakes warfare, with
multiple active components, safe terms such as
"guarantee" and "certainty" fall by the wayside.

If we were to do anything to prepare, it would be to
have Lady Epsilon undergo intensive training in how
to act in upper-class society.

Oh, that shouldn't be a problem. I came from a
wealthy family before becoming possessed.

Right. But the socio-culture of elven society is
different from that of humans. To be accepted as a
precious gemstone, you'll need to prepare for the
role.

Lady Alpha, you don't mean to go ahead with this
plan?!

I trust Epsilon can get it done. I will take full
responsibility for the results.
Lady Alpha...

Besides, as Epsilon points out in her proposal,
unless we actively increase the means to reach
the upper classes,

we're unlikely to see future expansion in the fashion
business or Tuna King. You understand that, don't
you, Gamma?
Urk...

In other words, Luna, Ltd. must engage in what Lambda
calls "high-stakes warfare."
We must take risks—not just Epsilon, but you as well.
...Epsilon.
Yes!

I'll leave this plan...to you. Should you need
anything, I'll do my best to procure it.

Don't overwhelm yourself, but make sure you do this
to the best of your ability!

Um, Gamma, if you're going to agree to me doing it,
it'd be nice if you could send me off with a smile...
...You've got this, Epsilon!

Thanks! Leave it to me, Gamma! I promise I'll make my
debut!
Good luck, Epsilon.
Thank you so much, Lady Alpha!

Well, now that's decided...can I leave it to you,
Lambda?

Sir! Yes sir! Lady Epsilon, I will spare no effort in
teaching you how to socialize in high society!
I look forward to the challenge!
I will become...a pianist!
